page.title: 05Sandys Arms
page.content: Situated just off the A44 Evesham - Oxford road, in the village of Wickhamford, is the public house known as The Sandys Arms. The pub, which is over 100 years old, takes it's name from the Sandys family who once lived at The Manor in Wickhamford. There is a public bar and a lounge where many different types of drink are served, the most popular being beer and wine. Customers tend to be local people. Games such as crib,dominoes,cards and darts are played regularly, and a quiz competition is held on Sundays. Food is served at lunch times, and in good weather it is possible to eat and drink on the lawn ouside.
